value.title: Dataflows and power query - November 2020 update
value.excerpt: Have you seen the new and upcoming features released on November 2020 for Dataflows and Power Query? In today's video, I will go through them so you stay up to date:  00:00 Intro 00:24 New Diagram view 01:36 New schema view 02:16 Add column from example  02:20 Add web from example 03:13 Fuzzy grouping

value.title: DAX Fridays! #11: Using variables in DAX
value.excerpt: Variables are an extremely useful feature in DAX, but perhaps not a well known one. Variables, 1. Make your formulas more readable 2. You can reuse them through your report 3. Can also be tables 4. Are more efficient  Download our Growth dashboard if you want to see the example live:http://curbal.com/blog/the-ultimate-dashboard-to-track-your-website-growth-with-google-analytics-and-power-bi-supercharged-excel

value.title: DAX Fridays! #122: DAX Variables deep dive
value.excerpt: Lets do a deep dive into variables shall we? In this video, I am going to cover the following: 1. Naming variables, dos and donts 2. The syntax for calling variables 3. value.title: DAX Fridays #16: DATEADD
value.excerpt: DATEADD is a really useful function to create sets of dates backwords or forward from a point in time. It is used for Previous date calculations. In this video, I show you how it works.  Link to DAX Studio: https://daxstudio.codeplex.com/  Link to YTD video and Power BI file: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=5WGOTsYngCI

value.title: DAX fridays! #19: DIVIDE
value.excerpt: Let's go through DIVIDE() function available in DAX! value.title: DAX Fridays! #30: SEARCH vs FIND
value.excerpt: In today's DAX Fridays! tutorial we are going to go though examples on how to use two DAX functions: SEARCH and FIND  SEARCH and FIND DAX functions are used to find the number of characters at which a specific word is found in a column. value.excerpt: In today's video I will review the new functionality released by Microsoft in the April 2017 Power BI update called Quick Measures.
